a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Inequality of incomes before and after taxes and transfers,
The horizontal axis measures inequality of 'market incomes' (i.e. income before taxes and transfers). The vertical
axis measures inequality of disposable incomes (i.e. income after taxes and transfers). In both cases inequality is
measured by the Gini Coefficient (higher values reflect more inequality).
Gini coefficient (income after taxes and transfers)
Data source: OECD Income Distribution Database (2016)
Note: Income before taxes and transfers corresponds to 'market income' (gross wages and salaries + self-employment income + capital
and property income).Income after taxes and transfers corresponds to 'disposable income' (disposable income = market income + social
security cash transfers + private transfers –income tax).
